t: Proverbs 29
One*pn who becomes stiff-necked, after*ln many reprimands will*ln be shattered instantly — beyond*ln recovery.
When*pn the righteous flourish, the people rejoice, but*ln when the wicked rule, people groan.
A*pn man who loves wisdom brings joy to his father, but*ln one who consorts with prostitutes destroys his wealth.
By*pn justice a king brings stability to a land, but*ln a person who demands “contributions” demolishes*ln it.
A*pn person who flatters his neighbor spreads*ln a net for his feet.
An*pn evil person is caught by sin, but*ln the righteous one sings and rejoices.
The*pn righteous person knows the rights of the poor, but*ln the wicked one does not understand these concerns.
Mockers*pn inflame a city, but*ln the wise turn away anger.
If*pn a wise person goes to court with a fool, there*ln will be ranting and raving but no resolution.
Bloodthirsty*pn men hate an honest person, but*ln the upright care about him.
A*pn fool gives full vent to his anger, but*ln a wise person holds it in check.
If*pn a ruler listens to lies, all*ln his officials will be wicked.
The*pn poor and the oppressor have this in common: the*ln Lord*s gives light to the eyes of both.
A*pn king who judges the poor with fairness — his*ln throne will be established forever.
A*pn rod of correction imparts wisdom, but*ln a youth left to himself is*ln a disgrace to his mother.
When*pn the wicked increase, rebellion increases, but*ln the righteous will see their downfall.
Discipline*pn your child, and it will bring you peace of mind and*ln give you delight.
Without*pn revelation people run wild, but*ln one who follows divine instruction will be happy.
A*pn servant cannot be disciplined by words; though*ln he understands, he doesn’t respond.
Do*pn you see someone who speaks too soon? There*ln is more hope for a fool than for him.
A*pn servant pampered from his youth will*ln become arrogant later on.
An*pn angry person stirs up conflict, and*ln a hot-tempered one increases rebellion.
A*pn person’s pride will humble him, but*ln a humble spirit will gain honor.
To*pn be a thief’s partner is to hate oneself; he*ln hears the curse but will not testify.
The*pn fear of mankind is a snare, but*ln the one who trusts in the Lord*s is protected.
Many*pn desire a ruler’s favor, but*ln a person receives justice from the Lord.*s
An*pn unjust person is detestable to the righteous, and*ln one whose way is upright is*ln detestable to the wicked.
